title: What do you think about the song 'bulleya' from 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil' movie? - Quora

response.answer_text: Title The title of the song “Bulleya” refers to Bulleh Shah,he was a great Punjabi Sufi poet, and philosopher.References to Bulleh Shah have been made in many hindi and punjabi songs in Bollywood,and now it has become a trend. Melody Melody of the song is strong & interesting,neither its speedy nor slow it remains in pitch. Lyrics Lyrics are deep and meaningful,selection of words is awesome,words like, “Jajeera,Tajalli,Murshid,Parvardigar,Pagdandi”, creates a beautiful impact on hearing for the first time. Instrumental & digital effects Instruments sounded like original,engaging,powerful and creative. Artist This song is sung by Amit mishra who had also given his voice in dilwale,dishoom.He is a trained musician and classical singer and of course we all are loving his voice in bulleya. Performence of the song Overall the song is beautiful and definitely this song is going to be a huge hit.

Bulleya… when I first heard the song I said Ok. After 2 days again heard it and the 2nd line of the song touched me near “tasalli toh dilade…” and it kept growing in me since then. The song is a soulful track with powwrful voice of Amit Mishra full of feel, wonderful music by Pritam Da. But the real winner is the lyrics. It's undoubtedly one of the best lyrics of Bollywood of all time. Superb lyrics. The bird of his soul doesn't get even a small island of relief even after flying so long… The song works from the heart, the lyrics touch you, the feel touch you. The voice touch you. Undoubtedly best song of the year.
